result.execSummary:
The defendant Gordon E Schmitt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

miscConds.notes:
Counseling deemed necessary.

Absolute sobriety.   Do not enter any establishment whose primary purpose is to sell or serve alcohol.

No contact with Q.M.

timeConds.notes:
Pursuant to 303.08 Work Release/Huber Privileges.

May be served in Taylor County.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gordon E Schmitt

Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: 8:36 Defendant Gordon E Schmitt in court with attorney Patrick Thomas Arendt.  Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

10:38 Defendant Gordon E Schmitt in court with attorney Patrick Thomas Arendt.  Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Grode asks Court to take judicial notice of 08CF150, a prior drug conviction. Court takes judicial notice.
Jim Cramm is sworn as a witness and questioned by Attorney Grode. He is an officer with the Marshfield Police Department. On 9/3/14, he had contact with a residence in the City of Marshfield. One of the occupants of the residence was the defendant. The witness identifies the defendant in the courtroom. He searched  a red duffle bag in the residence. There was clothing and drug paraphernalia in the bag. The items were sent to the State Crime Lab. The substances were positive for methamphetamine and defendant's fingerprints were on the items. The witness admitted to owning the duffle bag. Attorney Arendt cross-examines witness. 
Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the defendant committed it. Bound over for further proceedings. Bond is continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 6, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment at 10-05-2015 10:30 am
9:09 Defendant Gordon E Schmitt in court with attorney Patrick Thomas Arendt.  Craig Lambert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Count 1 bound over for preliminary hearing. Waives times limits.
